caption: A true classic slice in NYC
Legendary Pizza
Best pizza on the Upper West Side, not even close.
Pizza is still great,been buying pizza from S&C since the 80's. Only downside is waiting outside in the rain being they only allow 2 people at a time.

NY style. Best pizza on UWS. Because of homemade dough with NYC water! Have them take it out 1 minute early carry it home hot and put 2-4 slices in your oven for just a few more minutes for extra crispy crust. Next day reheat the rest in oven, with a few anchovies.  Thin crust but not "too thin". Regular cheese has plenty of cheese. If they aren't busy you can be from order to pie in ~15 minutes.  They also sell by the slice, if you happen to be walking by - but come on, are you a tourist or are you looking for comfort food for dinner?
Best pizza in the area. Classic NYC slice.

Nothing fancy, nothing crazy, wild or unique - but that’s precisely why I gave it 5 stars. Get the plain cheese slice. It’s exactly 100% what a classic NYC slice of pizza should taste like. It’s just a simple NY slice of pizza done perfectly.
Never got my delivery order

(Translated by Google) it's delicious. Haha, the staff was friendly and it was nice. Haha, because I was standing outside and eating, he brought out the table and chairs.. haha  (Original) 맛있어요. ㅎㅎ 직원분들도 친절하셔서 좋았어요.ㅎㅎ 밖에서 서서 먹고 있으니까 테이블이랑 의자 꺼내주셨다는.. ㅎㅎ

This is one of the better secrets in Manhattan. Virtually no place to sit down inside just counterv service but for a gas oven, slice shop, it is pretty good. Not outrageously price but very freshly made pizza. Be careful, metered parking is scare but their product is far better than most pizzerias.
Classic taste nyc pizza. Very good! No dining area so you gotta grab your slice on the go!

The crust. The crust is what does it for me. I have very strong opinions about pizza, especially as the selection on the UWS is paltry. I had one place that I swore by, but took a chance and ordered a regular pie from Sal and Carmine’s to give it a whirl. It’s awesome. If you like thicker, fluffier crust like I do, you will love this place.
Best pizza in New York
A lot of hype for average product.
Classic!!
It’s nice... but not the best
The best of the best, since the 70’s. Delicious, crisp crust pizza.
1st time visitors...love the crust!
This is a pretty solid pizza, nice by the slice, thin and fresh.

Best pizza in town - tons of flavor in the sauce, good crust.  The mushrooms and peppers taste like they're of out of a jar - would prefer fresh.  Pepperoni is excellent - well seasoned with a little kick but not too spicy.  Good service and delivery options with typical wait times.
Do not order delivery from here. They took two hours to deliver one large pizza three blocks away
Good standard NY slice, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it. Great flavor ... sauce, cheese and dough all solid. A bit on the thick and saucy side.

BEWARE, the pizza recipe HAS CHANGED. Now it's a super-cheesy goopy slice right out of Times Square. Don't let old local hippies fool you with their tales of this supposed "classic slice" joint. It's anything but.
(Translated by Google) Best pizza in UWS!  (Original) Best pizza in UWS!
Best pizza.
texture is perfect, standard taste
My go-to for pizza for many years.
No nonsense pizza! 👌🏼

Best slice in NYC. Period. Come correct to this family place (since 1959). Honor their commitment to quality by being kind and civil. Clean up after yourself. I probably should have kept this place a secret. At $3.00 the cheese slice is unquestionably the best food value in the city. Small seating area in the back. No restroom.
best pizza I've ever had

That's a good slice. Sal and Carmine is a pretty classic slice joint. Good quality cheese,  generous size,  clean tomato flavor from the sauce,  nice crunch to the crust.  For under $3 you're hard pressed to find anything to eat on the Upper West Side. That Sal & Carmines is SO legit and inexpensive is one of the joys of city street food.
Great pizza
Pretty great pizza, wish it was a dollar tho. Oh well it smacks and it’s pretty much the only place that’s been on that block for over twenty years.

(Translated by Google) I'm late. I didn't expect it at first, so I bought one coke for a $ 3 cheese pizza and bought it for $ 4. I ate a bite and ran to the counter and ate another slice of pizza and a cola and ate it just before the batter. It's not very salty, and it's great to have a slice of cheese pizza and ricotta pizza. It is a house where locals come to eat when they are bored. Overwhelming compared to the expensive and salty pizza shops in the guidebook. THE BEST PIZZA EVER.  (Original) 미 쳣 다 . 처음엔 그닥 기대하지 않아 3달러짜리 치즈피자 한조각에 콜라하나 해서 4달러에 구입. 한입먹고 카운터로 달려가 다른 피자 두조각, 콜라하나 더 시켜서 배터지기직전까지 먹었다. 겨타 뉴욕피자들관 다르게 그다지 짜지 않으며, 치즈피자 + 리코타 피자 한조각씩 먹으면 아주 좋다. 현지인들이 심심하면 와서 먹는 집이다. 가이드북에 있는 비싸고 짠 피자집들과 비교하면 압도적인 집. THE BEST PIZZA EVER.

I grew up in Brooklyn in the ‘60s, and Ilive in Wisconsin now. I’m always surprised when I come to Manhattan how hard it is to find a good slice of plain cheese.  Finally found it here. Delicious. Added to my favorites.
I had my first slice over  4 decades ago' I had a slice today and still the best ever.
Good pizza ,the best
Been coming here since I was 7.  One of the best pizza slices in NYC.  If u want to taste what great old ny pizza tasted like this is the place!!
Great service super slices!
Great Pizza
Best pizza I've had in the city.
My favorite pizza for over forty years and still going strong. I still bring everyone I can to try it.
Yummy traditional NY pizza!
Solid thinner crust slice.  The pepperoni slice had a slight crunch to it which was awesome.  Sauce had s hint of sweetness.  Definitely one of the best places to get a real slice on the UWS.

This place is legendary. It reminds me of the pizzerias in Queens in the early 80s. Absolutely fantastic cheese slice. Sauce and cheese balance each other out while being held up by a thin, yet crispy and chewy crust.  This is my favorite slice in the vicinity of Columbia University.
Best pizza on the upper west side
Best pizza
Very authentic New York pizza.  Thin crust, gigantic slices of delicious food.  This is a must-visit for anybody wanting the NYC pizza experience.

this. is. the best. slice. in nyc. pepperoni is definitely better than bleeker streets and all those that live in this hood are so lucky its a local joint for them. the crust has the perfect balance of greasy and gooey top with a nice flop on the crust without losing crispiness. its just a solid slice of heaven
Best individual take on pizza on the upper west side
Cash-only and super super worth it. A great vibe, an incredible slice, and really friendly service!
Best pizza in the area by far.  If you're anywhere near here, get a slice
Best pizza in America
I love the plain slices. I come here to remember what great NY pizza tastes like.
Best pizza ever.
The best pizza in NYC!
Never disappoints
The pizza is really good
Delicious!!
The best pizza in NYC
Best pizza in New York. The Most authentic italian slice.
The absolute, swear-on-my-own-grave, BEST pizza

Couple of things wrong with this place one it says it has large slices and it doesn't really have large slices and the person is rude when asked about the large slices was told the world was large slices when said to them that's not a large slice kind of false advertisement was toll if you don't like it take it up with your mayor so I refuse to eat at this restaurant
How does a pizza shop run out of cheese? Mind blown. Terrible customer service. Then they got the nerve to joke about it.
Nice pizza
A classic slice

Fantastic New York style slices. This is where you can get the quintessential New York city thin crust slice. All components come together here to make a nearly flawless slice. Perfect chewy, tender crust. Perfectly prepared sauce and good quality cheese. We had pepperoni and sausage slices. The pepperoni slice was excellent aside for a bit greasy but that's an expected side effect to most New York pepperoni slices. 4.5 stars. The sausage slice was better and totally 5 stars with excellent fresh sliced sausage and not a bit greasy. Service was friendly and quick. There's a small seating area in rear with about 10 tables. It was not very well ventilated but did have working ceiling fans. Atmosphere is casual. Highly recommend.
This is the bad place in new york, orrible pizza

(Translated by Google) Ah the cheese pizza was so delicious. A moderately thin dough, slightly sour tomato sauce. Why was this ordinary pizza delicious? Was it New York Mulberry? Feeling very American space.  534  (Original) 아 여기 치즈피자 너무 맛있었음. 적당히 얇은 도우에 좀 시큼한 편인 토마토 소스. 왜 이 평범한 피자가 맛있었을까. 뉴욕뽕이었을까. 지극히 미국스러운 공간도 정감감.  534
Still the best Tasty Pizza in NYC. outstanding. After 65+ years taste remains tasty & delicious.
I LOVE Sal and Carmine's! Long time neighborhood pizza joint. No frills, just delicious pizza.
Best place for pizza! The pizza is fresh and delicious. When I’m in the mood for pizza this is the place I go!
Great place for pizza
Asked for garlic and their was literal chunks of garlic that I almost choked on. The pizza was super soggy as well. I would not recommend this place.
You have to try this pizza, we have 3 top pizzerias around but this one is in my opinion the best pizza ive ever had in manhattan. Want flavor? Yep this is it
Best pizza on the Upper West Side.
Best pizza in NYC must try.

Wanted 4 pepperoni slices (at $4 each) at 6:45pm (they are open until 10.) Was told they were out of pepperoni. At 6:45pm. They wanted us to order a $27 pepperoni pie ($27?)  I asked them if they were going to make more pepperoni before 10 pm, and they said "of course." A#*holes! Skipped the wonderful "hometown atmosphere" of this dump and got a 3 topping large at Dominos for $8. I'm all for preserving local *good* business, but to charge 3 times as much and refuse to make what the customer wants? Let them drown.

caption: One of the best slices in the city!
Nice pizza !

The best for my 53 years. Unique authentic, 2 special secrets layered on the authentic dough. Cheese & TBD🤗
Best pizza anywhere and I've been to many different states. I've been eating there since the early 70s when they were on 95th.
Sal and Carmine Pizza is an iconic place for pizza in midtown. Classic NYC slices.
Best pizza in New York, best NY style pizza anywhere

Waited 1hr15 to get our delivery. We paid 27$ for a Marguerite pizza. They said it was extra for that style. No problem. Three ingredients, very easy, what could go wrong. It comes like the photo below, no basil, over cooked, stringy mozzarella. My 95 year old Sicilian grandmother had to sprinkle dry basil spice on it to make it edible 😂. Sauce is sweet like a cheap pasta sauce. Honestly I was starving and barely got through one slice. Very disappointed.
Not flawless, but definitely the best pizzeria in the area. They have been around for a while now and they are definitely worth a visit.
I am from Los Angeles and I think it's great pizza . Although I am not eating pizza often I like this pizza. The portion of the bread cheese and the sauce is great.
Really good pizza
Had a yummy slice today. Good service and the people are friendly.😊
Insanely good slice of pizza 😋
This pizzarea has been owned by the same family for ever. The mozzarella slice is a must when I visit. UWS staple 🍕🍕🍕🍕
Great pizza! No messing around! Should have ordered the cheese pizza!
Very good. A little cheesy, but a delicious slice no doubt.
Awesome pizza
One of the great old-time NYC pizzerias. Unassuming, spartan even, but excellent pizza served by gruff old guys. Worth the trip!
Excellent New York slice place.
Best pizza in NYC!
This the the local spot, my friend lives close by and we always go there!  Friendly Staff & good quality pizza! Check them out!!

This is the absolute best pizza in the entire godforsaken world and I go there whenever I am in New York. It is so comforting and delicious and pro tip: have the pepperoni pizza with some of their Cherry Coke; best meal you’ll ever have. This is one of those places you need to go to before you die. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

The guy at the counter wasn't very friendly. The Pizza's Tasted good but I would say it's not worth spending 3 dollars for a plain cheese slice especially when there are so many amazing pizzerias in Manhattan.
The pizza was made fresh in front of us. The enough sauce and cheese, crust was crunchy and delicious.
Good pizza

The absolute go-to pizza place in Manhattan Valley/Upper West. Their slices are classic, uncomplicated, and just darn good. You can tell their ingredients are step above your average pizza joint, especially the cheese and meats. My usual order is a slice of pepperoni and a slice of sausage, but you really can't go wrong with anything here.

This is my number one go-to pizza joint and I luckily live a block away. Consistently fantastic pizza! I routinely grab several slices during the week enroute to the train and always a large pepperoni on Sundays.
Best pizza ever! (Italy included)
Worst experience ever. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone and will never order from this place ever again
Love the pies here, and Lou is my main nyc bro!
Best pizza on the upper west side, my opinion
Best slice in the city. I go with pepperoni, but you really can't go wrong.
It's always a pleasure to go there and eat really Italian pizza
This is my favorite pizza place in NYC! Those pepperoni slices are the best 🍕!!!
Solid slice place!
Best "gas oven" pizza on New York City
S&C's was the best slice joint on earth, but all that's left is the name. Not bad, but nothing special.
You know or you don't.

Been going here since we moved uptown in the mid-90’s. Definitely one of the best pizza joints around. Crust is crispy, folds perfectly. The sauce is flavorful- not just tomato sauce. Real cheese tops it off. A little pricey- $3 a slice but well worth it. I always buy at least 2 slices. Wait for a pie fresh out of the oven. Worth the wait!! A real NYC old school classic!!!
Perfect
Been going there since I was born and the pizza is still to die for. Crispy, with sweet tomato sauce. Pizza heaven.
Ordered a pizza within the hour of closing, and received a text that they have cancelled my order.
Perfect NY slice
Good pizza

Come for the pizza - and the history. Sal & Carmine's has been in the neighborhood for almost 60 years, since 1959, first on B'way in the 90s and, for the last 35 years  on B'way between 101st and 102nd. It's a tiny independent shop with a counter and a few tables in the back.  The pizza is old-fashioned: hot, chewy, more crust than cheese. None of those Chicago or Sicilian slices. Old-style NYC pizza, straight up.
Very good

The best! PERIOD! I grew up on the upper westside eight blocks from S&C. They talk about Chicago Pizza, California Pizza, Detroit Pizza! Please, it's garbage! Ain't no good pizza west of the Mississippi or west of New York for that matter! It's right here in the Big Apple! Grab A Slice of Heaven!😂
Great pizza & friendly service!

I know I know I will not try to sound cliche BUT this is one of the best pizzas of NYC! Period. Why because it has that old school taste, because the crust is perfectly crunchy but soft, how is this possible? You'll have to go and find out...GREAT taste and service.
Great pizza. Only occasionally makes lists of best pizza in the city, but easily the best on the UWS.
The best pizza in New York, hands down!!! I have been eating there for over 50 years and  have yet to find a slice that compares...
Best pizza on upper west side
Best pizza I've ever had
A little pricey but definitely worth it. Best pizza in Manhattan. Been coming here for years and the staff is always very nice.
Best pizza in nyc
Great pizza
Absolutely wonderful pizza! Probably one of the best I have ever ate.
Great Pizza from an NYC classic!
Dante wasn't the only one to visit heaven. Pizza isn't supposed to be sublime. Happily for us, Sal & Carmine's never got that memo.
Very ordinary...

Forget about Joe's, this is the quintissential New York pizza slice. Pizza is so good you have to forgive the guys for their occasional attitude. Usually that's a stamp of quality in my book--the more attitude, the better the food  Cheese slice is really the one to get, the white is good too but others are babysteps backwards. NEVER get the mushrooms, they come soggy from a can and will ruin your pizza.
Kinda of pricey. $4 for one slice, but great pizza.
Best pizza in the neighborhood

Extremely rude and obnoxious to their customers. There are many better pizza options where they are nice and courteous. The pizza has long lost the quality that used to make it good a long time ago. Frankly now not worth the experience at all.
Not bad, decent pizza. Love the atmosphere reminds me of the places of yore
Best slice in the UWS, maybe even the city
Amazing pizza and very nice stuff !
Best pizza in town.
The people here are SUPER nice. The pizza is amazing. If you are in the neighborhood, definitely stop by to grab a slice.
Reminded me of pizza from the old days. Sauce was nice I went Early so was just me and the baby. Baby slept I ate a nice tasty slice
Classic pizza joint. Been going here since I was a kid. If you go late and they're out of pies, they'll often make one up for you. A fresh pie is worth the wait.

I stopped in for a slice after hearing raves from several friends. I will say it was a pretty solid slice. The dough had a great taste and the pizza was cooked really well. It's a classic NYC pizza joint and it's nothing fancy but they pull off a solid slice. The main issue I have is that it's $4 for a slice which feels very expensive and there's little discount if you buy the whole pie.
A little bit on the pricey side but definitely worth it if you appreciate good ny pizza. Guys behind the counter are super nice too.
Sal's is delicious!  The bestest.
The pizza is the best in the neighborhood, counter guy could use a customer sevice refresher course.

I like a good pizza and I do have to say New York City has some of the best pizza I have ever eaten even on a trip to Venice, Italy. I lived for three years in NYC and tried different pizzas during my time there. So when my daughter and I were in NYC in October 2018 for an overnight visit to see the city, we traveled here to try the pizza. I read an article back in 2017 that it was rated one of the best pizzas in NYC. I told the guys there that I traveled from Virginia and since I was in Manhattan I want to try their pizza  because of that article. So I ordered one slice of cheese pizza because my daughter said she was not hungry.... well that changed really quick after she took a bite of my pizza. I went and got another slice and after one bite I also agreed that this was really good pizza and went and ordered two more whole pizzas (one pepperoni) to take with us back to Virginia. I had parchment paper and an extra shoulder bag to carry the pizza in... by the way guys the pizza made it with no problem and still tasted good!!  Of course the guys thought I was a little crazy and asked if there are no good pizza makers in Virginia... mostly no unless you find a good place that makes it like this. They should consider opening a pizza restaurant down here!!  The guys are friendly, they use the best ingredients to create the pizzas they make, the restaurant is clean and enough seating for normal traffic or you can take it with you (use a pizza box).
Still one of the greatest
Super solid fresh mozzarella slice.
A great slice, worth the trip
Great pizza
Crisp and salty pepperoni. 4 dollars but pretty large piece. What I imagine a ny slice would be
I've known this place since 1998. Best pizzas in NYC, believe me.
Great pizza by the slice served by friendly guys!
Spinach one was good, but white one was too greasy. Just try a basic thing, it would be better. It was not that good but fine.

We loved this place on our trip and went there a couple of time for a cheese slice. Lovely guys working there and probably the best pizza i've ever eaten! I didn't know cheese pizza could taste so good
Best Slice in NYC
It's cash only and $3. Very good pizza, the owner won't recognize me but I've been going since I was 12.
Very good. Just the right amount of everything. Friendly service. Fresh,  good size slices. Good experience.
Really good slice. I wouldn’t travel really far to get it (it’s not so much better than other options in the city). But if you find yourself in the UWS you won’t be dissatisfied.

Excellent pizza by the slice or whole pie. Slices fold well and hold their shape. Electric oven.  At the back there are a few tables to eat at. Not much atmosphere - you’re better eating on the sidewalk or by the counter.
Possibly the best traditional pizza slices in the world.  What else do I need to say?
Hands down the best pizza I've ever had in my life, so far.
I dont get the hype
Best sports bar and restaurant in the neighborhood
Great pie 🤗🤗🤗🤗

I absolutely loved Sal & Carmines. This is a classic genuine old school NYC pizzeria. Delicious. I haven't been to my old neighborhood in 15+ years and was looking for pizza that would bring me back and have my spouse experience it too.
I went here by myself and then I recommended my friends to come and visit. Its a very simple and not fancy place. One of the best places to eat a good slice of pizza 🍕

Very little about this place has changed since the 1950s. It's a relic of the past and it's cheap. For many in the neighborhood this place represents home, or something consistent and reliable and perfectly fine.
I don't know what makes their slices so much better tasting than pretty much every other NY-style pizza place. It's just magic. Hope they never change.
Best pizza in NYC.  Bar none.
delicious! great atmosphere (there isnt much seating but it wasnt crowded for me) the staff is very personable and will chat. 3$ for a big slice

Very long wait time and that is because each pizza is made individually from scratch - totally worth the wait but won't recommend if you just want a quick slice - the pizza is somewjere in between a typical NYC greasy pizza and Grimaldi's - it's feels and tastes of high quality ingredients
That guy who is attending today June 18 2018,  8 PM he was very aggressive and rude to me and another clients,  that bad image for the good service that you had before
Pizza is fresh had 3 slices
One of the best places to get a slice. The pizza is well balanced- the cheese isn’t too salty, the pizza isn’t too greasy, and the sauce isn’t sweet. Good thin crust. I’m a big fan
One of the best pizza slices in town. I always stop by when I’m in town!

I read a handful of different comments, but I was drawn to check this place out due to my curiosity; and I'm glad I followed my inner guidance---despite the not so inviting, recent, negative reviews---because I was reminded of an unexpected, priceless, ultimate, life lesson.  Initially, the young guy making a pizza didn't exactly come off as warm and fuzzy friendly, so I can understand why certain people expressed what they did.  However COMMA when I took a brief moment to see beyond the outer "rough" surface---by shifting from limited, human, physical mind perspective to the unlimited, Soul/Spirit, Multidimensional, expanded perspective (consciousness)---I was able to truly SEE a human being busily doing his best to do a good job as fast as he can (and who knows how many other personal and/or work-related stress factors, that we all go through, have influenced his not so happy appearing demeanor).  I tried the freshly-made Grandma's pizza, and it actually tasted like one of our back-in-the-day grandmamas had made it with love (though she may not be smiley on the outside).  To my great surprise, when I asked the same guy a question before leaving, he seemingly transformed into a genuinely friendly, enthusiastic, and helpful being.  I initially thought, "Who is this guy?"; but I then trusted that I must have shifted into a parallel Earth reality once I chose to see the bigger picture (aka open my mind and heart/raise my vibrational frequency).  I gave him a big tip and his face lit up even more, and he sincerely thanked me. Like all of us at times, he just needed a break in life from all the super busyness and various stress factors.  I was recently reminded that humanity has experienced much CONDITIONAL love throughout human history; hence, there are many wounded souls/wounded wounders who havent healed on deep levels.  But I trust than we, as humanity evolving on all energy levels of our being---physical, mental, emotional, financial (poverty consciousness to Prosperity Consciousness), and spiritual---can choose to Be our full-potential/Multidimensional Selves/Wounded Healers who choose NOT to intentionally hurt self/others because we're aware that we're all interconnected parts of the whole (like trillions of cells within one body), and we've learned that it doesn't FEEL good to be hurt by another (to include from the judgmental aspect of ourselves).  I have no doubt that we can help make our lives on this planet a little more smoother, more peaceful, abundant, wise, free, and happier by practicing to unconditionally love more and more aspects of ourselves (since True Love starts from within)---the duality/polarity of the so-called good and bad, right and wrong, dark and light, etc.---which helps us to embrace more and more of interconnected Life within this Universe and beyond.
Very solid pizza.
For the life of me, I can't understand the good reviews on here. The pizza is way too salty. The people who work here are unpleasant and I have seen them treat some people extremely rudely.

I got a slice of pizze twice in this place. The first time it gave me the worst heartburn of my life. So I decided to never have pizza there again. Then one day, years later, I was craving pizza and there’s not a lot of choice in the neighborhood. So I gave it another shot: terrible heartburn ensued. Plus they are not friendly at all. So, one star, for lack of the zero star option.

This place has the best pizza but the worst service. They will close with no notice and leave your order in limbo. Forget about Seamless, these guys never update their status so you will place an order and wait and hour and a half before calling and listening to the phone ring endlessly. I’m the idiot who has tried again and again only to be ignored. Never again.
Best pizza in the world. Grew up down the street from the original location. Stop there when I'm in town.
Best  Pizza in New york. I travel from Newark New Jersey just for a slice.
Best pizza in NYC

In our early trips to NYC in the 1980's, we decided to find "the best pizza". We found many small joints who only sold pizza and by the slice. Surprisingly, most were great. THIN, CHEWY and very TASTY crust. A plain slice of cheese pizza was great! Now, most of these joints have disappeared, thanks to the big franchise pizzerias. Lucky for us, Sal and Carmine still has that old style taste. Definitely worth a try and a trip to the UWS!
Need better furniture but the pizza is awesome
My favorite pizza in Manhattan. Get a sausage or meatball slice. Or cheese. Just go.
It's hard to find a better pizza!
My favorite pizza in NYC
True authentic New York pizza

BIGGOTED OWNER: DO NOT EAT HERE! I live in the neighborhood and used to frequent until today. The old man who runs the shop ALWAYS has a rude attitude (1.5 years of personally experiencing this behavior, despite tipping, etc.) and treats non-cisgender females with contempt. Upon my last visit (12/9/17) after taking my order the old man yelled "I HATE THIS PLACE" and continued to mutter obscenities under his breath. When I gave him the money to pay he told me to "not be so prissy" to which I responded for him to "not be so rude." He continued to mutter until I asked I'm why he treats me and my friends so poorly, to which he made no eye contact and gave no response. I asked if it was because he was a bigot, and I was gay? To which he responded "What do you want me to say? Take your pizza and get out, don't come back!" DO NOT EAT HERE! THERE IS BETTER PIZZA SOLD BY BETTER PEOPLE! Broadway pizza(104/Bway) is just as good, and not homophobic.
Best basic pizza in nyc!
Solid, no-frills NYC Pizza.
they have a oerfect pizza and service, so i recommend this place!!!
Best slice on the uws by far.
The sausage slice was bellissimo!
This place has time all pizza in North Carolina for me :P. This is already know first stop when traveling to NYC. You can't go wrong with any slice!
The place is very tiny but i was greeted by a very nice young man who gave me a very good tasting pizza!!!!! ❤ coming back to eat here pretty much every day am in NYC
I been that pizza restaurant seen I was a little kid along time ago. Also, the pizza it's so great n really taste like Italian pizza 😋😋😊😊🍕🍕🍕🍕😎😎😎

THIS PLACE IS NOT CLEAN  and the service was horrible- they guy was mean to my kids. We went there for lunch with my two toddlers 6/22 at 12:15. The place was pretty empty (never a good sign) ordered, the guy behind the counter was SO rude. He refused to give extra paper plates for my kids, who make a habit of dropping and ripping everything. He said that the store had no plastic cups so my 2 year olds ended up drinking from the water bottle (which is fine normally, but unnecessarily stressful). Then my kid spilled some of the water they were precariously drinking from the bottle  on the table so I went to wipe it up and the table was FILTHILY, the napkin I used was black with dirt and soot from the table.
Best pizza in the neighborhood.
Gruff, don't come here for anything but, a perfect pie. Otherwise go frak yourself. Delivery only happens on Friday or Saturday. Worth the Shlep.
Fantastic crust and flavor.
Greatest slice of all time!!! Nothing in NYC even compare.

Brought our family here for Thanksgiving dinner. The food was delicious--every item was seasoned perfectly and such great quality. The portions were very large and we had lots of leftovers. We'd love to make Carmine's our Thanksgiving tradition!
The best spot on the UWS for a classic NYC slice
I miss this place now that I don't live on 97th street. Best slice of cheese possibly ever. No frills just pizza.
Best old fashioned slice in NYC.

Brought our family here for Thanksgiving dinner. The food was delicious--every item was seasoned perfectly and such great quality. The portions were very large and we had lots of leftovers. We'd love to make Carmine's our Thanksgiving tradition!
This is the best pizza on the Upper West Side. While you might pay a little bit more than other places ($3/slice, even if you buy a whole pie), it absolutely worth it for the delicious pizza you get.
Good pizza in morgue- like atmosphere. Go for the pizza!
I liked pizza a lot, it's perfect one! I like the price too ;)
The best pizza on the Upper West Side.  Big slices and an old school decor.

Down to earth, no frills and plus no hipsters. I think the old guard has had enough and is handing off the skills and brand off to heir apparents, so follow up and review, as times change and unfortunately short cuts can ruin institutions.

Haha, only rating it 5 because of the food, but service isn't great. I mean, the guys in there are cheeky, which can be good, but they lie too much on the actual rude side of that. Just be aware that you might feel offended when you go in there.  Worth it for the pizza though?  Ummm, yeah. ;) Just go somewhere else to eat it.
Classic NY slice. No frills. Delicious.
Great pizza. Sauce and dough were impeccable.
Good pizza. Would have been much better but way too much salt.  Im sure the originals owners would agree.
Nice place for grabbing a slice and chill for a minute.

(Translated by Google) Very good dough, they could add more tomato and / or cheese. They made us too "light."  (Original) Masa muy buena, podrían añadir más tomate y/o queso. Se nos hicieron demasiado "ligeras".
Really solid slice in the UWS. The seating is limited, but that's not why you're here. The staff are friendly and quick, and the pizza is excellent.
Great pizza if you are ordering delivery. Do NOT go into the shop. Staff is rude will just take a piss at you . They probably don't like people eating in.
Best pizza on the Upper West Side, some would say in the City or even the world.  I grew up two blocks away and have been a loyal customer for 30 years.

OMG.. like stepping back in time. Old style manual register greets you in the window. No AC No service No frills pizza joint. The cheese slice of pizza was like eating butter, sauce and bread. Dripping with grease, crispy and delicious. Sign said it opened in 1959. Slice of pizza was probably 25 cents. Now 3 dollars and worth every bite. If you're in the neighborhood and feel like stepping back in time grab a slice at Sal and Carmine's

Best tasting dough in the neighborhood, hands down. I second what other reviews have stated: the standard cheese slice is about as "New York" as it gets. We also order the "Grandma Pie" for delivery and damn, that is good.
Great classic pie - great sauce - a little warm inside in summer but well worth it.
Cheese slice and Cel-ray soda is what you get. Get something with toppings only after you've tried the cheese. This is the best pizza in the known universe
Glorious base, perfect sauce amount, right amount of cheese. Can't ask for a better slice.

If you want the top pizza in NYC then this is the place. This is as New York as pizza gets. They understand that the staff isn't supposed to be good. They get that the place might not be clean, or spacious, or even nice looking. They focus on the one thing that brings value back, the pizza. You go here to eat pizza. That's it. And you will enjoy it because it is incredible.
Great slice!
Best slices around here.
Very average but good enough pizza.

Customer service is not good and it's just an oily pizza that is made with old dough. They don't like colored people because whenever I go in they stop smiling and just mug any one who is not white. Just because some famous people had to eat a quick bite of sub par pizza they think it's good.
Best plain slice I've had in a while,  recommend for anyone staying/visiting NYC

My favorite slice a za ever. I will admit it is on the salty side and orne time I went in at like 8:30 PM on a Monday night and it wasn't good. That night was the only time out of like 10 times I have been there that is was really poor. The service isn't friendly, the place is dingy, but the pizza is amazing. If you go around lunch time I have found it to be the best. Easy access from the subway too if you are staying in midtown.
This is the best slice on the UWS-- period. You get it served with a touch of old-school NYC grumpiness from the man himself.

I had decent pizza here - thin, chewy, and easy to eat. A little bit more variety would have been pleasing (only 3 different pizza to choose from around 7pm on a weekday). The interior also looks somewhat uninspiring - the walls are decorated with newspaper snippets from a reward they won more than 10 years ago.  I certainly had better pizza slices in New York City but not in this neighborhood - that should tell you something about the food options on the UWS.
Best pizza on the upper west side.

The cheese is good but there the dough and sauce is mediocre. Take extra napkins for the oil that is bound to drip and take away the true taste. They like to Touch cash money and the hand you a pizza without any gloves (Nasty) and might I add they like to cough on your pizza if they do not like the customer's. Dough Boys Pizza on 33'rd and 3 ave. will be a better option.

I think that Sal & Carmine's will forever be my reference in terms of slice excellence. Slightly surly service, pure NYC lore and life, serving up what it does best: off-kilter triangles of pizza. That crust with a bit of saltiness, crisp and chew, the thin layer of cheese over the swath of sauce, all in a grungy, yet clean, space bedecked with yellowed posters and commemorations of jobs well done. Still deserving.
the Best

Dropped in for a slice and was not disappointed. The crust was just right with all the tiny air pockets from well rested dough that's been allowed to ferment and rise properly. Why some pizza places rush the dough is beyond me. The bottom was perfectly baked with no sogginess and the sauce was just how I like it, light. The cheese was a good amount and not too salty.  Authentic New York style pizza.
Pricey but perfect fresh taste!
I saw a couple of baby mouses not good by the kitchen
Very good pizza, tasty, thin dough ,good amount of cheese and sauce
(Translated by Google) Best pizza on UWS.  (Original) Best pizza on UWS.

An institution in the neighborhood!  Just plain delicious pizza!  Great crust, plentiful toppings when you order them...Now Sal's nephew is making the pies and he is continuing the tradition, insuring it will be around another generation.   The ambiance is bleh---but that isn't what you go there for.  Its totally in keeping with an authentic New York pizza joint
Excellent pizza in cozy, understated restaurant.

(Translated by Google) A good place to eat a slice of pizza. It is very good and are American-style portions (very large). It's 4 $ the portion The older man who attends is true that he is very serious, but who cares. Worth  (Original) Un buen sitio para comer una porción de pizza. Esta muy buena y son porciones al estilo americano (muy grandes). Son 4$ la porción El señor mayor que atiende es verdad que es muy serio, pero a quien le importa. Merece la pena

Have been going to Sal and Carmine's for almost ten years. Definitely the best pizza on the Upper West Side and arguably one of the best pizzerias in NYC. Slices are nicely sized and filling. Atmosphere is what you'd expect of a neighborhood pizza joint- quaint, nothing fancy. Family owned. Three dollar slices. My favorite is cheese. Pepperoni is good, too. I highly recommend getting a cheese slice or two before delving into toppings. Eat in or take out. They do not deliver. More than worth the trip though.

Sal and Carmine's has been serving pizza in this upper west side neighborhood since 1959. That speaks volumes in an environment that sees frequent and rapid turnover in terms of eating spots.  Don't expect fancy decor or an extensive menu in this tiny spot. They specialize in fresh hand made New York Style pizza and that is what they deliciously deliver. Next time you're in the area and you feel like a grab and go slice, visit Sal & Carmine's.
If you are near, get a slice

Rustic crust. Lots of flour still on the bottom. Sauce is eh ok. Cheese eh ok. Slices are $3.00 the guys are super unfriendly. Apparently they have been here for 50 years. Maybe it's time to retire. Walk 1 more block to Broadway Pizza you won't regret it.
(Translated by Google) Very rich, worth the trip.  (Original) Muy ricas, vale la pena el viaje.
Fett nice

Best pizza in the world! Sal and Carmines is my dads favorite pizzeria, he has been going there since he was a little kid. the pizza has a delicious crust. Anytime you are there you can chat with Sal!
A good, solid slice at an good price.

This place is in excellent proximity to my house, thus, it is easy for me to get pizza on the daily. I have never had better pizza sauce. This is the best pizza on the upper west side, because it has a nice family vibe. There is a great selection of drinks such as yoohoo, root beer, and sprite. Finally, remember to get their mushroom pizza--it is sublime.

this has been the best pizza on our two week trip through New York, and we've been getting a slice at pretty much every place we pass.  big foldable slices, great sauce, amazing crust.  if you only get pizza from one place in Manhattan, get it here.

Best slice of pizza in NYC, in my opinion.  A classic pizza spot run by disgruntled father and son. My dad has been going to Sal and Carmine's since he was a teenager, and now I go there any time I'm in the neighborhood.  Delicious thick crust, salty pizza.  I want a slice right now.

Sal and Carmine's is a great pizza joint - a real classic place.  The place has been around forever with good reason.  The pies are delicious, the staff is friendly and they've recently added (limited) delivery.  The pies are a bit on the pricey side but definitely worth it.  There is some limited seating in the back but this spot puts its energies into the pie, not the decor.
They only rarely deliver but the pizza is salty and delicious.
Best pizza in town, practically moved to my current apartment to be near it. A bit on a pricey slide for a slice, but there's a reason this place is legendary.

Flavorful crust.  Crispy if they cook it long enough.  The tomato sauce and the cheese taste great, and the toppings are very good.  Fine, honest, New York pizza by three guys -- one somewhat serious, even glum late middle-aged guy, one grumpy older guy, and one serious and mildly sardonic younger guy.  They do, in fact, carry Dr. Brown's Diet Cream soda, a definite plus.
The canonical cheese slice, served by two grumpy old men in a tiny space.
